review: The key is you have "access" to lots of television shows and movies. But, what it doesn't tell you is that you have to pay to watch most of them! $2.99 to watch an episode of General Hospital! I can watch for free on ABC.com. Honestly, I incorrectly assumed I would have access to the Internet through this system. The voice activation was a very cool feature. But, if I have to pay for nearly everything, the voice activation is not worth it. The point of getting this system for my family was to save money from the high fees of Cable television. This system was not the solution.

review: 3 1/2 stars.  So far it's pretty good.  Size, speed, price, Prime Music and Video.  The available Apps are OK.  The UI could be better (scrolling from left to right can be annoying if you have a lot of movies or even apps to go through) but I figure that will get better with time.  However, the Parental Controls (FreeTime) still does not allow you to add any movie you want from either your Watch list, Recommendations or any available Prime Instant Video.  The only thing it allows you to add from is from your Video Library, in other words, what you have purchased.  Unless you plan on actually buying a lot of movies, that's messed up.  Bottom line, it needs better Parental Controls.More Apps are needed but I figure that will come in time as well.Overall, the price, search function, Prime Music/Prime Instant Video and hardware are great!  The UI, Parental Controls and App availability could certainly be better.
author: J. in Colorado

review: The Fire TV is a must have! The voice search is amazing.  I even found  a Spanish title movie by saying it in Spanish.  The speed of browsing through the choices is instantaneous.  It is just as fast as my going through my Tivo.  The Fire TV, like the Tivo, is one of those gadgets that once you have used it, you can't live without it!  I monitored the electrical usage  of the Fire TV for 112 hours, and it used 0.48 watts.
